Posts.Content: For many months this site was a source of support and comfort during my treatments for Stage 3 Prostate Cancer. I want to thank everyone and those who continue to be treated will always be in my heart and prayers. I had posted that my walking had gotten more difficult and painful and asked if anyone had any experiences with this issue. In time my Hormone Oncologist guested the cause and sent me to a Specialist. I have a serious case of Spinal Stenosis and will be having surgery in April. I again want to thank everyone who contributes to this wonderful site and please know folks are praying for you and I. God bless and keep you, Gregg

Posts.Content: We just got home from seeing my tests results; the cancer has not spread to my Bones and most likely not to my organs. There is a small spot on the liver, however he is sending me for a second opinion and feels we must go after the Prostate Cancer. Treatment will be with Hormone Therapy and Radiation after the second opinion and as soon as it is possible. The spot on the liver did not show up on both tests and is so small he does not want to wait any longer then getting the second opinion and starting my treatment. Posts.Title: Does anyone know how this new Treatment in NJ replaces 42 Radiations with 5 ?

Posts.Content: Does anyone know how this new Treatment in NJ replaces 42 Radiations with 5 ? The TV stations in Philadelphia run their add several times a day. We live in Northeast PA, I am going to the Morgan Cancer Center which I am told is one of the best. I can tell you this there are no finer, kinder, helpful, more patient staff and Radiation Tech then I have met at Morgan. When I see my Radiation Doctor, we see him once a week to check on us and review how we are doing. I will ask him myself at that time. How 5 Treatments at this NJ Radiation Center can replace and can accomplish the same results as the 45 Treatments I am receiving is a mystery to me. However until I see him I just wondered if anyone here has had knowledge of this procedure? Many thanks,

Posts.Content: I am still following the forum, at this point I am getting the Hormone Therapy then on July 19 I begin my 45 Radiation Treatments. Monday I have to have a Needle Biopsy of my Thyroid, I have nodules and after 5 years they have increased in size. If there is any relationship no one is able to say until the biopsy results come in. HOWEVER I FEEL GOOD AND WANTED TO SAY HAPPY FOURTH OF JULY AND THANK YOU ALL FOR ALL YOUR HELP, ENCOURAGEMENT AND SUPPORT. The compulsion to run out and have a Perm and have my nails done after my first Hormone treatment have passed and I am doing much better. My voice is coming back from the Hormone Therapy and people have stopped asking if it is Nancy or myself answering the phone.

Posts.Title: A Happy and safe Fourth of July to everyone for 2013

Posts.Content: I shared I have Prostate Cancer and have started Hormone Therapy and very soon my Radiation Therapy. I believe I mentioned that about a week ago I went for my yearly Thyroid Checkup. I have nodules and for the first time in 5 years they have enlarged. Five years ago the Needle Biopsy indicated they were not cancerous. However because of the increase in size I am leaving in a few minutes for a new Needle Biopsy of my Thyroid. More then anything I am wondering how they will treat both cancers if the nodules are now cancerous. I appreciate being able to share this with my friends on the Prostate Cancer Forum since that is how I first came here. Nancy is strong and supportive however having worked in Pathology sometimes she understands too well. I can come here and share without causing her more worries before it is necessary. My throat has been scratchy and my voice a little ruff at times I suspect and read these are indicators of something with the Thyroid. The same department and staff that did my Prostate Needle Biopsy and installed my Gold Flakes will be doing my Thyroid in an hour. I told the person who made the appointment I will have to introduce myself because up to now my association with the Specialist has been anything but FACE TO FACE. When I know more I will let you all know, God bless you one and all.

Posts.Title: What I Need to Know About External Beam Radiation Treatments

Posts.Content: My Radiation Oncologist has all of his patients drink at least 16 oz of water before our treatments. If we forget they will give us water and take the next person and come back to us. He has told all of us the bladder does better with Radiation Treatments and side affects if you have the Radiation Treatments with a full bladder. Needles to say there are plenty of restroom in the area of our treatments. It is my first stop before I drive home. He also sees everyone of his patients at least once a week during our Radiation Treatments and he takes the time to listen and answer all our questions. I told his staff I am surprised the door hasn't fallen off the rest room from so many people using day after day.

Posts.Content: I have not been to the Specialist yet and will check with him. However I am reading more and more about leg pains and my type of leg pains being caused by the Hormone Treatments. I finished my 45 Radiation Treatments however I am still receiving Hormone Treatments and will be for some months to come. More and more I am reading that lower testosterone levels from Hormone Treatments can clearly cause the kind of pains I am experiencing. Before my 45 Radiation Treatments my PSA was 20.9 my Gleason was 7 and the split was 4-3. I am continuing to receive Hormone Treatments for maybe another 6 months. After my Radiation Treatments my PSA was then 0.08

Posts.Content: My Primary Doctor was not one for testing and I figured he was knew best, that was my mistake. In May I had to go to the him and Nancy said to insist on a PSA it had been too long already. I insisted and he agreed to do the PSA Test. The PSA was 20.7, the Radiation Oncologist went over my records closely and found the last time the Primary Doctor did a PSA was four years ago and my PSA was only 2. He wasn't going to say anything but you could sense that he did not think it was good that my Primary had not done a PSA in four years. This time the Primary Doctor did the PSA only because I insisted because of Nancy's advice and it went from 2.0 to 20.7 and my Gleason is 7 in those four years. If I had a yearly PSA they may have discovered this before it got this high. The Radiation Oncologist also said because it did increase that much in four years it was the more aggressive form of Prostate Cancer and had to be treated immediately. This is what the Urologist had to us and he had us go to the Oncologist for a second opinion immediately. They both told us to tell my sons to start having PSAs starting at age 40 and to have them regularly and not let their Doctor allow four years to pass between them. I had the Needle Biopsy and it showed that 70-75 percent of the test issue had cancer in it. We do not know my fathers family history because they died of other issues from years of smoking and drinking, my mothers side were all dead early on and we had no way of finding a history of it in Moms' family anymore. The PSA testing is a painless easy way to test, I regret not insisting sooner or more often. I would recommend it at the very least. It put us on to my Prostate Cancer and the need for more testing and direct testing and treatment

AgeInfo.Phrase: having PSAs starting at age 40 and to have them regularly

Posts.Signature: Sincerely yours, Friendly 2 Corinthians 1:4 He comforts us in all our affliction, so that we may be able to comfort those who are in any kind of affliction, through the comfort we ourselves receive from God..
Posts.Title: Value of Testing and Treatment

Posts.Content: mkane09, I believe you are correct, years ago NBC did a report on Americans dying of treatable diseases because they could not afford the treatments. It is happening again and will more in the coming months and years. The IRS has been assigned to regulate the Obama Health Care Coverage by the Obama Administration. I had to go to the emergency room for a badly broken wrist 2 years ago, it looked like a Z shape. After giving my name we sat and sat and sat as families brought their children into the emergency room as though it their family doctor's office. Finally I could not stand the pain anymore, it required an operation and steel plate to repair, I went up to the window and asked how does one get a broken wrist looked at since we were waiting for people with simple colds to get treated? The nurse said WHAT MAKES YOU THINK YOU HAVE A BROKEN WRIST AND I SHOWED HER THE Z shaped wrist. She said I will get a doctor. Anymore our area of USA has become a relocation center for the Caribbean Commonwealth of the USA. They get what they need free or from a program. I am asking myself do I want to spend our life savings to try to live and still die leaving Nancy broke or die and leave Nancy with some kind of resources. Nancy will not hear of it, she wants me. I love her and I worry who will take care of her because she is not included in any of these special treatment groups. We got a Blue Cross Blue Shield Blue for SENIORS supplemental health care policy a PPO. THE FIRST SPECIALIST WE WENT TO see SAID HE DOES NOT ACCEPT it because it restricts the treatments too much for people who need the prescribed treatments. His staff was tried of fighting with BC/BS for the patients. Swell the first time we tried to use our SPECIAL SENIOR plan the SPECIALIST does not accept it and it was supposedly designed for SENIORS. YEA RIGHT.

The Radiation Oncologist also said because it did increase that much in four years it was the more aggressive form of Prostate Cancer and had to be treated immediately. This is what the Urologist had to us and he had us go to the Oncologist for a second opinion immediately. They both told us to tell my sons to start having PSAs starting at age 40 and to have them regularly and not let their Doctor allow four years to pass between them. I had the Needle Biopsy and it showed that 70-75 percent of the test issue had cancer in it. We do not know my fathers family history because they died of other issues from years of smoking and drinking, my mothers side were all dead early on and we had no way of finding a history of it in Moms' family anymore. The PSA testing is a painless easy way to test, I regret not insisting sooner or more often. I would recommend it at the very least. It put us on to my Prostate Cancer and the need for more testing and direct testing and treatment

Posts.Content: What I learned about LEG PAIN after months of Hormone Therapy this past week at my 6 Month Checkup. My PSA was 20.9, Gleason 7 and the split was 4/3 last spring when my Prostate was diagnosed. I never had any really outward symptoms before the first PSA test my doctor would do in 4 years. I had 45 Radiation Treatments and a string of Hormones starting before the Radiation Treatments that continue for a full 22 or 24 months. A month after the Radiation Treatments were completed I began to have pains in both my legs, the pains were in both legs and identical. They continued to get stronger and my family doctor wrote me a prescription of an Anti Inflammatory medication. This week I questioned my Radiation Doctor if the pain could be related to my treatments and not my cancer spreading. He said Oh yes some people get these leg pains from the Hormone Treatments. He said if I could stand to go on with them the chance of the Cancer returning are greatly reduced. If I had less or discontinued the Hormones there is a greater chance of the cancer returning. I told him I am most relieved it is not Cancer spreading and I will continue to deal with the leg pains knowing now what it is. I should add my PSA is currently 0.1 so the leg pain is a painful distraction believe me, however it is worth it to get PSAs like this. The Compulsion from the Hormone Treatments to run out and have my nails done and get a perm is decreasing too, JOKE

Posts.Content: My family doctor had my blood tested for any Vitamin deficiencies. I was taking additional Magnesium and D3 because we were told the treatments can reduce this and affect your bone tissue and muscles. The blood test revealed I needed to take more D3 and increasing this could or should improve my leg problems. It also helps one to fight other illnesses and help recoveries from some cancers

Posts.Title: Value of Testing and Treatment

Posts.Content: Thanking God for a miracle today, we went over my Bone Scan and Kat Scan at the Urologist Tuesday. It has not spread however my PSA is 20. and the Gleason Score 7 however apparently my Prostate Cancer is the more aggressive form. It as found at the beginning and not afterwards. I am going with the hormone and radiation. The Urologist suggested a highly respected and highly rated Radiation Oncologist in our area. However the Urologist was not sure this man was accessible because of the number of patients he already has. The Urologists' staff was going to call today because I need to start my treatments immediately. While searching on the WWW Tuesday night I found a link to this Oncologist and it had his email address. I took a chance and wrote him, I told him who I was seeing and my test results and how much it would mean to my family if I could be treated by him. This morning I started up the old PC and there was a wonderful email answer from this very doctor himself. He told me his staff would call me this morning to get in to see him TODAY. At 2:00 P.M. Nancy and I got in to see him. He is everything we heard he was and more. He is going to take my case and he works well with my Urologist and has in the past. I called my Urologist and they were amazed because they had not called him yet and had doubts he could take me on. Until we got to the appointment the Urologist had everything faxed directly to the Oncologist. He went over everything with us carefully and patiently. My Prostate Cancer is an aggressive type HOWEVER IT WAS CAUGHT early in it progress not after it had gotten into my bones and organs. He is starting treatment immediately with Hormone Therapy to better prepare me for the Radiation treatment that will come. No one can believe I got this Oncologist because he gets patients from all over. Then to find him to be patient, very complete in his explaining everything, and very compassionate was great. EVERYTHING I LEARNED ON THIS SITE FITS INTO WHAT HE EXPLAINED TO US AND HOW THE TREATMENT WILL PROCESS! To me it gave me great confidence in the help I received on this site and the advice given to people like myself who knows nothing about this when it struck. I thank everyone who worked so hard to establish this wonderful Forum. You have given us hope and the hope lead us to a Great Urologist and now a GREAT Oncologist. I am going to continue to come here to learn all that I can and if I can offer hope to others, as this site has given us hope.

Posts.Content: I have received one Hormone Treatment and will receive another 7/9 then Radiation, 45 treatments soon after along with the continued Hormone Therapy. I may have to go to the Thyroid Cancer Link for this answer. I have nodules in my Thyroid that are checked yearly. This week I had my first Thyroid Checkup since being told in May I have Prostate Cancer. My PSA is 20.7 and the Gleason is 7. The Endocrinologist discovered Tuesday the nodules have increased in size for the first time since they were discovered. A few years ago I had a Needle Biopsy that showed they were not cancerous, now he is going to check them again with a new Needle Biopsy.. Does any know if their increase in size could be linked to my Prostate Cancer or the Hormones I am taking?

Posts.Content: I only asked because a few years ago the nodules were discovered and I had an Ultrasound followed by a Needle Biopsy at that time. Since then I go yearly for a check and Ultrasound the Needle Biopsy showed the nodules not to be cancerous. Then we went through all the tests recently to confirm I have Prostate Cancer and after going in for my yearly Thyroid check up suddenly the nodules have increased in size. They are going to have a NEW Needle Biopsy done as soon as they can make the arrangements and I was wondering if anyone ever had this happen in connection with their Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Title: I have received one Hormone Treatment and will receive another 7/9 then Radiation.

Posts.Content: I don't know what happened to my last posting. I will not know more before Tuesday, however this does state that Cancer of the Prostate can lead to unsteadiness and shortness of breath. These along with leg cramps and pain while walking are all things I have been treated for however no one had tested me for Prostate Cancer at this point. Cancer of prostate develops in the prostate gland and typically develops slowly. Advanced prostate cancer could extend to the brain or other body parts. The brain is one of the most common sites of metastasis from solid tumors. When symptoms of metastatic cancer take place, the type and frequency of the symptoms will rely on the size and location of the metastasis. For instance, cancer that extends to the bones is probable to lead to pain and can cause bone fractures. Cancer that extends to the brain can lead to various symptoms including headaches, seizures and unsteadiness. Shortness of breath might be a sign of lung involvement. Article Source: http://EzineArticles.com/3877141 When I learn more on Tuesday I will come back with more information. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR PATIENCE AND HELP, this is all new to me and I realize some of my answers are not what you need to share more.

Posts.Title: I was wondering if anyone else experienced this as a symptom of Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Content: Thank you I was just diagnosed with the Prostate Cancer earlier this month. My doctor sent in a blood test and it returned with what he called Double Digit PSA numbers I believe. The Specialist found 70-75 percent of the needle biopsy samples contained cancer. He immediately ordered a Bone Scan and Kat Scan that I had yesterday and will find out the extent of the cancer on Tuesday. This is all new to me. I mentioned the unsteadiness because someone told me how they experienced some of what I have been having because it spread to his internal organs possibly his liver. I had Vertigo a couple years back, a bad case of it. It never seemed to go away and my legs started to cramp and my unsteadiness seemed to get worse. The person I spoke to have a similar experience and it was the cancer spreading to his internal organs. A lot of time was wasted on treating what we thought was Vertigo and the doctor thought the cramping and my problems with walking were from medications. I found this site and asked the question because this happened to this individual I was hoping to find out if this was something others experienced. Believe me I am not well versed in this yet. I know the Specialist felt someone should have been testing me more regularly and by the time I got there my count was high. I insisted on a Blood Test because of my wife who understands these things much better then I do made it clear I had to get a blood test it had been too long since my last. Now the Specialist told my wife and I to let our sons know they need to be getting tested starting at the age of 40, he suspects it runs in the family. I told him my father, Uncle and Grandfather died of life style issues and we would not have known if they had Prostate Cancer because smoking and drinking took them out in the long run. All this is new to me, I have much to learn, if my answers are not complete I go Tuesday and will try to get more complete answers.

AgeInfo.Phrase: starting at the age of 40  he suspects it runs in

Posts.Title: Value of Testing and Treatment

Posts.Content: mkane09, I believe you are correct, years ago NBC did a report on Americans dying of treatable diseases because they could not afford the treatments. It is happening again and will more in the coming months and years. The IRS has been assigned to regulate the Obama Health Care Coverage by the Obama Administration. I had to go to the emergency room for a badly broken wrist 2 years ago, it looked like a Z shape. After giving my name we sat and sat and sat as families brought their children into the emergency room as though it their family doctor's office. Finally I could not stand the pain anymore, it required an operation and steel plate to repair, I went up to the window and asked how does one get a broken wrist looked at since we were waiting for people with simple colds to get treated? The nurse said WHAT MAKES YOU THINK YOU HAVE A BROKEN WRIST AND I SHOWED HER THE Z shaped wrist. She said I will get a doctor. Anymore our area of USA has become a relocation center for the Caribbean Commonwealth of the USA. They get what they need free or from a program. I am asking myself do I want to spend our life savings to try to live and still die leaving Nancy broke or die and leave Nancy with some kind of resources. Nancy will not hear of it, she wants me. I love her and I worry who will take care of her because she is not included in any of these special treatment groups. We got a Blue Cross Blue Shield Blue for SENIORS supplemental health care policy a PPO. THE FIRST SPECIALIST WE WENT TO see SAID HE DOES NOT ACCEPT it because it restricts the treatments too much for people who need the prescribed treatments. His staff was tried of fighting with BC/BS for the patients. Swell the first time we tried to use our SPECIAL SENIOR plan the SPECIALIST does not accept it and it was supposedly designed for SENIORS. YEA RIGHT.

Posts.Title: What I learned about LEG PAIN after months of Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: I greatly appreciate all your replies and personal experiences. This kind of thing was never mentioned during my treatments or visits to the Doctors. It had my wife very worried that the Cancer had spread into my bones or legs at least. The Radiologist did confirm this month at my checkup this can happen and he described the pain I am feeling better then I could. I knew then I was not the first one to experience this from my Treatments, he put it on the Hormones, but who really knows. Walking is difficult and painful but once it a while I get a little relief from inflammatory medications. For the last three years and a year back I have been volunteering in a local Elementary Autistic Class with 8 boys. It has been a huge blessing and the boys are great, however the pain is making it harder to do this. I just pray I can continue. Many times it would appear some of their worse problems are coming from their dysfunctional homes and life outside of school and not their Autism. They try to help me walk faster by taking my hands, they mean well however I can not move faster the pain has slowed me up. If I cough it can be enough to send the pains down both legs for a sharp minute. AGAIN MANY THANKS to all of you for your replies., I thank God I have had excellent PSAs and I had Stage 3 Prostate Cancer. I am thankful for my recovery I just will have to learn to operate with this pain apparently, I have 11 more Hormone Treatments maybe things will get better.

Posts.Title: What I learned about LEG PAIN after months of Hormone Therapy

Posts.Content: I greatly appreciate all your replies and personal experiences. This kind of thing was never mentioned during my treatments or visits to the Doctors. It had my wife very worried that the Cancer had spread into my bones or legs at least. The Radiologist did confirm this month at my checkup this can happen and he described the pain I am feeling better then I could. I knew then I was not the first one to experience this from my Treatments, he put it on the Hormones, but who really knows. Walking is difficult and painful but once it a while I get a little relief from inflammatory medications. For the last three years and a year back I have been volunteering in a local Elementary Autistic Class with 8 boys. It has been a huge blessing and the boys are great, however the pain is making it harder to do this. I just pray I can continue. Many times it would appear some of their worse problems are coming from their dysfunctional homes and life outside of school and not their Autism. They try to help me walk faster by taking my hands, they mean well however I can not move faster the pain has slowed me up. If I cough it can be enough to send the pains down both legs for a sharp minute. AGAIN MANY THANKS to all of you for your replies., I thank God I have had excellent PSAs and I had Stage 3 Prostate Cancer. I am thankful for my recovery I just will have to learn to operate with this pain apparently, I have 11 more Hormone Treatments maybe things will get better.

It is happening again and will more in the coming months and years. The IRS has been assigned to regulate the Obama Health Care Coverage by the Obama Administration. I had to go to the emergency room for a badly broken wrist 2 years ago, it looked like a Z shape. After giving my name we sat and sat and sat as families brought their children into the emergency room as though it their family doctor's office. Finally I could not stand the pain anymore, it required an operation and steel plate to repair, I went up to the window and asked how does one get a broken wrist looked at since we were waiting for people with simple colds to get treated? The nurse said WHAT MAKES YOU THINK YOU HAVE A BROKEN WRIST AND I SHOWED HER THE Z shaped wrist. She said I will get a doctor. Anymore our area of USA has become a relocation center for the Caribbean Commonwealth of the USA. They get what they need free or from a program. I am asking myself do I want to spend our life savings to try to live and still die leaving Nancy broke or die and leave Nancy with some kind of resources. Nancy will not hear of it, she wants me. I love her and I worry who will take care of her because she is not included in any of these special treatment groups. We got a Blue Cross Blue Shield Blue for SENIORS supplemental health care policy a PPO. THE FIRST SPECIALIST WE WENT TO see SAID HE DOES NOT ACCEPT it because it restricts the treatments too much for people who need the prescribed treatments. His staff was tried of fighting with BC/BS for the patients. Swell the first time we tried to use our SPECIAL SENIOR plan the SPECIALIST does not accept it and it was supposedly designed for SENIORS. YEA RIGHT.

Posts.Content: Top User, My wife worked in Pathology for years and understands medicine much better than I do. She has been a blessing many times over the years. Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Fairwind Infection is a minor risk with today's techniques and procedure. A bigger worry will be the blood in your urine and semen..Be SURE to stop taking aspirin or fish oil 2 weeks before the procedure or heavy bleeding can result...You may want to purge your semen yourself after a few days to avoid shocking your sex partner.. Fairwind, you are right, my doctor told me this might happen and to be prepared. I had Kidney Stones over the years and had blood in my urine however with this it was much deeper in color and took me back for a minute. In a few days it got better and soon it was gone. I only mentioned it because it was not like my Kidney stone experience it was a much deeper red after my biopsy. I had to take a strong antibiotic the night before the biopsy, the morning of it that night again and the next morning. I had no problems with an infection now I am having the Gold flakes placed in my Prostate this week and it is the same thing again for this procedure.

Posts.Title: I was wondering if anyone else experienced this as a symptom of Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Content: I don't know what happened to my last posting. I will not know more before Tuesday, however this does state that Cancer of the Prostate can lead to unsteadiness and shortness of breath. These along with leg cramps and pain while walking are all things I have been treated for however no one had tested me for Prostate Cancer at this point. Cancer of prostate develops in the prostate gland and typically develops slowly. Advanced prostate cancer could extend to the brain or other body parts. The brain is one of the most common sites of metastasis from solid tumors. When symptoms of metastatic cancer take place, the type and frequency of the symptoms will rely on the size and location of the metastasis. For instance, cancer that extends to the bones is probable to lead to pain and can cause bone fractures. Cancer that extends to the brain can lead to various symptoms including headaches, seizures and unsteadiness. Shortness of breath might be a sign of lung involvement. Article Source: http://EzineArticles.com/3877141 When I learn more on Tuesday I will come back with more information. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUR PATIENCE AND HELP, this is all new to me and I realize some of my answers are not what you need to share more.

Posts.Title: I was wondering if anyone else experienced this as a symptom of Prostate Cancer.

Posts.Content: Thank you I was just diagnosed with the Prostate Cancer earlier this month. My doctor sent in a blood test and it returned with what he called Double Digit PSA numbers I believe. The Specialist found 70-75 percent of the needle biopsy samples contained cancer. He immediately ordered a Bone Scan and Kat Scan that I had yesterday and will find out the extent of the cancer on Tuesday. This is all new to me. I mentioned the unsteadiness because someone told me how they experienced some of what I have been having because it spread to his internal organs possibly his liver. I had Vertigo a couple years back, a bad case of it. It never seemed to go away and my legs started to cramp and my unsteadiness seemed to get worse. The person I spoke to have a similar experience and it was the cancer spreading to his internal organs. A lot of time was wasted on treating what we thought was Vertigo and the doctor thought the cramping and my problems with walking were from medications. I found this site and asked the question because this happened to this individual I was hoping to find out if this was something others experienced. Believe me I am not well versed in this yet. I know the Specialist felt someone should have been testing me more regularly and by the time I got there my count was high. I insisted on a Blood Test because of my wife who understands these things much better then I do made it clear I had to get a blood test it had been too long since my last. Now the Specialist told my wife and I to let our sons know they need to be getting tested starting at the age of 40, he suspects it runs in the family. I told him my father, Uncle and Grandfather died of life style issues and we would not have known if they had Prostate Cancer because smoking and drinking took them out in the long run. All this is new to me, I have much to learn, if my answers are not complete I go Tuesday and will try to get more complete answers.

Posts.Content: You bring up an issue I have been concerned with the cost of all this care. We have Medicare and a Secondary Plan from my wife's job. She hopes to work at least another year for now. I do not want to leave her with debt or eat up our savings trying to get me refurbished. If this was to becomes too costly and with the Obama changes apparently creating new and higher premiums with less options I have thought I would rather not even begin treatment. We live in an area where there was a large steel corporation. People I know worked long and hard to provide for their families to have some security after their passing. The steel corporation went belly up and the families have squat now. The wives are struggling to keep things going with the husbands having died and the company closing. We have several other large industries that have done this leaving the family struggling. I love my wife and she loves me, she wants the best for me and I for her. For me I don't want to leave her broke and struggling in this economy so I get a couple more years. She will not even discuss this with me, as I see the amounts of money it could cost us to get a couple more years I really struggle with even getting treatment.

Posts.Title: Does anyone know what kind of pill or capsule I will be taking with my Hormone T,

Posts.Content: My Hormone Therapy is going to go beyond the Radiation. I found this at the Mayo Site. I know the Radiation Oncologist told us I have a very aggressive form of Prostate Cancer, although it had not reached my bones yet only because of timing. He is going to have me on Hormone Therapy for probably 2 years, the Radiation Treatments are for 9 weeks. http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/pro...ents-and-drugs Hormone therapy is used in men with advanced prostate cancer to shrink the cancer and slow the growth of tumors. In men with early-stage prostate cancer, hormone therapy may be used to shrink tumors before radiation therapy. This can make it more likely that radiation therapy will be successful. Hormone therapy is sometimes used after surgery or radiation therapy to slow the growth of any cancer cells left behind.

Posts.Content: I called the Urologist today and they called in the medication this is what it is and does. Bicalutamide Pronunciation. Dosage Form: 50 mg tablet For ProfessionalsIndicationsSide EffectsDosageInteractionsMore.... 1. INDICATIONS AND USAGE Bicalutamide tablets, USP 50 mg daily are indicated for use in combination therapy with a luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone (LHRH) analog for the treatment of Stage D2 metastatic carcinoma of the prostate.

Posts.Title: I am sorry I wasn't sure the best place to post this question.

Posts.Content: I am sorry I wasn't sure the best place to post this question. Nancy knows everything I do about my Prostate Cancer the 20.7 PSA, Gleason Score of 7 and 70-75% of the biopsy tissue was cancerous. My Bone Scan and Kat Scan were good, however the Radiation Oncologist told us because of the speed of increase in the PSA in 4 years and the Gleason Score this is a more Aggressive Form of Prostate Cancer and we need to get busy. I have started the Hormone Therapy to prepare for the Radiation Treatments. At this point I am scheduled for a Radiation Treatment 5 times a week for 9 weeks for a total of 45 Radiation Treatments. There is a strong possibility of continued of more and continued Hormone Therapy during and after the Radiation. Nancy is asking me if anyone has mentioned the number of Radiation Treatments they had and if 45 is a lot. I know the Oncologist was VERY concerned and is considered one of the very best and respected in our part of Eastern PA. So the bottom line is 45 Radiation Treatments in 9 weeks a lot, average or whatever and MANY THANKS,
